required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Lotrafilcon A Contact Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Lotrafilcon A Contact Lenses

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this 3-month study is to evaluate subjective responses to an upgraded contact lens.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months of wear, replacing lenses monthly
primary_outcome.description: As interpreted by the participant and recorded on a questionnaire as a single, retrospective evaluation of 3 months of wear time. Overall comfort was evaluated binocularly and rated on a 10-point scale, with 1 being poor and 10 being excellent.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months of wear, replacing lenses monthly
secondary_outcome.description: As assessed by the investigator at study visit using a biomicroscope, which magnifies the appearance of the contact lens on the participant's eye. Lens fit was graded by eye on a 5-point scale, with 2=unacceptably loose, 1=acceptably loose, 0=optimal, -1=acceptably tight, and -2=unacceptably tight

intervention.intervention_name: Lotrafilcon A upgrade soft contact lens
intervention.description: Silicone hydrogel contact lens approved for daily wear and extended wear up to 30 consecutive nights.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have normal ocular findings.
- Be able to wear the study lenses in the available powers.
- Currently wear contact lenses for a minimum of 5 days a week, and at least 8 hours a day.
- Wear Night & Day contact lenses.
- Other protocol-defined inclusion criteria may apply.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Require concurrent ocular medication.
- Eye injury or surgery within twelve weeks prior to enrollment.
- Currently enrolled in an ophthalmic clinical trial.
- Any active corneal infection.
- Corneal refractive surgery.
- Wear AIR OPTIX NIGHT & DAY AQUA lenses.
- Other protocol-defined exclusion criteria may apply.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Thirteen US optometry sites recruited and enrolled subjects for this study.

group.title: Lotrafilcon A
group.description: Lotrafilcon A lenses worn for 3 months, replaced monthly. Lenses worn on the same basis as habitual lenses, as prescribed by eye care practitioner (e.g., daily wear, flexible wear, extended wear up to 30 continuous nights).

group.title: Lotrafilcon A
group.description: Lotrafilcon A lenses worn for 3 months, replaced monthly. Lenses worn on the same basis as habitual lenses, as prescribed by eye care practitioner (e.g., daily wear, flexible wear, extended wear up to 30 continuous nights).

outcome.title: Overall Comfort
outcome.description: As interpreted by the participant and recorded on a questionnaire as a single, retrospective evaluation of 3 months of wear time. Overall comfort was evaluated binocularly and rated on a 10-point scale, with 1 being poor and 10 being excellent.
outcome.time_frame: 3 months of wear, replacing lenses monthly
outcome.population: Analysis conducted per protocol, with exclusions due to reasons such as: major protocol deviations as determined by masked review; discontinuations; and/or missing responses.

group.title: Lotrafilcon A

measure.title: Overall Comfort
measure.description: As interpreted by the participant and recorded on a questionnaire as a single, retrospective evaluation of 3 months of wear time. Overall comfort was evaluated binocularly and rated on a 10-point scale, with 1 being poor and 10 being excellent.
measure.population: Analysis conducted per protocol, with exclusions due to reasons such as: major protocol deviations as determined by masked review; discontinuations; and/or missing responses.

outcome.title: Overall Lens Fit
outcome.description: As assessed by the investigator at study visit using a biomicroscope, which magnifies the appearance of the contact lens on the participant's eye. Lens fit was graded by eye on a 5-point scale, with 2=unacceptably loose, 1=acceptably loose, 0=optimal, -1=acceptably tight, and -2=unacceptably tight

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected for the duration of the trial: 143 days.
reported_events.desc: This reporting group includes all enrolled and exposed participants.

group.title: Lotrafilcon A

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: For a period of 10 years, the clinical investigator must hold all trial-related information and documents confidential and must agree to obtain sponsor's written consent before discussing, presenting, publicizing, or otherwise disclosing any preclinical and/or clinical data or impressions from this trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Sameena Haque-Khan, PhD, BSc(Hons)Optom, MCOptom, FAAO
